issue.title: Implement LDAP authentication for GL3
issue.body:
Description WIP (missing detailed explanation)

This PR enables LDAP authentication for GL3 based on a forked omniauth-ldap (because it is currently unmaintained).
This PR was not developed with the goal to be merged upstream, but I'd like to provide our development to the public for anyone in need of this.

This is the part of a series of similar PR submissions (Redis Sentinel, SAML integration, LDAP integration).

issue.title: Implement SAML authentication for GL3
issue.body:
Description WIP (missing detailed explanation)

This PR enables SAML authentication for GL3 and is based on similar PRs for GL2: https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/1334 and https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/2270 . We are using this feature in production, but it was not developed with the goal to be merged upstream. Because SAML for GL2 was never merged, I guess it won't happen for GL3 as well. However, I'd like to provide our development to the public for anyone in need of this.

This is the part of a series of similar PR submissions (Redis Sentinel, SAML integration, LDAP integration).

issue.title: Add env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replace checks for OPENID_CONNECT with checks for EXTERNAL_AUTH where applicable
issue.body:
Since OIDC is currently the only implemented external authentication provider, in all the places where you would normally check for external auth usage there is instead a check for OIDC usage. This PR introduces a new env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replaces these checks with a check for EXTERNAL_AUTH. Also a few comments are left at places where additional providers would have to be "added".

This paves the way for addition of other external auth providers and, even if there are no plans to develop these from upstream side, makes it easier to develop and maintain extensions such as https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/5476 . Also, it will not require any additional effort to maintain the changes made in this PR and it does not change the current behavior of GL3. 

If any changes have to be made to make this mergeable, I'm happy to work on them. Please let me know!

pull_request.title: Add env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replace checks for OPENID_CONNECT with checks for EXTERNAL_AUTH where applicable
pull_request.body:
Since OIDC is currently the only implemented external authentication provider, in all the places where you would normally check for external auth usage there is instead a check for OIDC usage. This PR introduces a new env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replaces these checks with a check for EXTERNAL_AUTH. Also a few comments are left at places where additional providers would have to be "added".

This paves the way for addition of other external auth providers and, even if there are no plans to develop these from upstream side, makes it easier to develop and maintain extensions such as https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/5476 . Also, it will not require any additional effort to maintain the changes made in this PR and it does not change the current behavior of GL3. 

If any changes have to be made to make this mergeable, I'm happy to work on them. Please let me know!

pull_request.title: Add env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replace checks for OPENID_CONNECT with checks for EXTERNAL_AUTH where applicable
pull_request.body:
Since OIDC is currently the only implemented external authentication provider, in all the places where you would normally check for external auth usage there is instead a check for OIDC usage. This PR introduces a new env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replaces these checks with a check for EXTERNAL_AUTH. Also a few comments are left at places where additional providers would have to be "added".

This paves the way for addition of other external auth providers and, even if there are no plans to develop these from upstream side, makes it easier to develop and maintain extensions such as https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/5476 . Also, it will not require any additional effort to maintain the changes made in this PR and it does not change the current behavior of GL3. 

If any changes have to be made to make this mergeable, I'm happy to work on them. Please let me know!

commits.message:
fix: Gemfile & Gemfile.lock to reduce vulnerabilities

The following vulnerabilities are fixed with an upgrade:

issue.title: keycloak login: e-mail change create a new user
issue.body:
Hi,

I use BBB with keycloak, using an identity federation with our LDAP. User logs with their LDAP uid and password in keycloak, and then use Greenlight.

When a user change it's e-mail, and then log in (using the same uid as before) in keycloak, a new user account with its new mail is created, instead of keeping its current account with its BBB rooms.

Is it possible to use username/uid instead of e-mail as identifiers? Or make keycloak change the mail in greenlight when it is changed in LDAP?

comment.body:
I search in keycloak how to change this, but didn't found how to… IMHO keycloak should return an uid attribute which should be the same as in the LDAP, and also a mail attribute…

If someone know how to get the right behavior, I think it should be interesting to document it… the default behavior is a regression compared to greenlight v2…

issue.title: CSRF Error only on particular instance, to be investigated further
issue.body:
~~Since [release-3.0.8.1](https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/releases/tag/release-3.0.8.1)~~ I noticed that I can get a CSRF error and am not able to start rooms / log out etc. in that particular browser tab, when I do the following:

- Not sure if necessary: Use external authn, log in with admin account
- Copy the link of one of your rooms
- Log out in that tab
- open a new tab, paste the link, log in on the join card
- Switch back to the previous tab
- You are now logged in there as well, but can't do anything meaningful ("The action can't be completed. please try again.")

In the server logs I see:

```
2023-10-23T07:12:39.997360+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: I, [2023-10-23T05:12:39.997156 #135]  INFO -- : [d365a28b-7f84-443c-a51e-03edae1f6671] method=GET path=/api/v1/rooms.json format=json controller=Api::V1::RoomsController action=index status=200 allocations=5560 duration=28.53 view=6.00 db=8.55 time=2023-10-23 05:12:39 UTC host=greenlight
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953396+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: W, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.952668 #135]  WARN -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] Can't verify CSRF token authenticity.
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953620+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: E, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.952929 #135] ERROR -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] Can't verify CSRF token authenticity.
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953755+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: E, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.953186 #135] ERROR -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] /usr/src/app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.2.0/gems/actionpack-7.1.0/lib/action_controller/metal/request_forgery_protection.rb:293:in `handle_unverified_request'
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953860+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: /usr/src/app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.2.0/gems/actionpack-7.1.0/lib/action_controller/metal/request_forgery_protection.rb:388:in `handle_unverified_request'
```

I can't reproduce the same ~~with earlier versions, so it must have been introduced with 3.0.8.1.~~ on other instances and so far I have no idea why that is. I'll update the issue as soon as I know more.

```
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953755+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: E, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.953186 #135] ERROR -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] /usr/src/app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.2.0/gems/actionpack-7.1.0/lib/action_controller/metal/request_forgery_protection.rb:293:in `handle_unverified_request'

```

I can't reproduce the same ~~with earlier versions, so it must have been introduced with 3.0.8.1.~~ on other instances and so far I have no idea why that is. I'll update the issue as soon as I know more.

comment.body: @ffdixon @farhatahmad Yes, but it is not actually an issue with GL3 but has to do with the configuration of that particular GL instance and our IDP. Sorry... I'll close the issue.

issue.title: CSRF Error only on particular instance, to be investigated further
issue.body:
~~Since [release-3.0.8.1](https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/releases/tag/release-3.0.8.1)~~ I noticed that I can get a CSRF error and am not able to start rooms / log out etc. in that particular browser tab, when I do the following:

- Not sure if necessary: Use external authn, log in with admin account
- Copy the link of one of your rooms
- Log out in that tab
- open a new tab, paste the link, log in on the join card
- Switch back to the previous tab
- You are now logged in there as well, but can't do anything meaningful ("The action can't be completed. please try again.")

In the server logs I see:

```
2023-10-23T07:12:39.997360+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: I, [2023-10-23T05:12:39.997156 #135]  INFO -- : [d365a28b-7f84-443c-a51e-03edae1f6671] method=GET path=/api/v1/rooms.json format=json controller=Api::V1::RoomsController action=index status=200 allocations=5560 duration=28.53 view=6.00 db=8.55 time=2023-10-23 05:12:39 UTC host=greenlight
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953396+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: W, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.952668 #135]  WARN -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] Can't verify CSRF token authenticity.
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953620+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: E, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.952929 #135] ERROR -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] Can't verify CSRF token authenticity.
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953755+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: E, [2023-10-23T05:12:42.953186 #135] ERROR -- : [e7421f56-0df4-4c02-ac46-ee11812bedc7] /usr/src/app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.2.0/gems/actionpack-7.1.0/lib/action_controller/metal/request_forgery_protection.rb:293:in `handle_unverified_request'
2023-10-23T07:12:42.953860+02:00 bbbtest-greenlight3-01 greenlight3_app.2.m7yixiixhdrmg04qycwrz1oy8/11db475fe5aa[852]: /usr/src/app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.2.0/gems/actionpack-7.1.0/lib/action_controller/metal/request_forgery_protection.rb:388:in `handle_unverified_request'
```

I can't reproduce the same ~~with earlier versions, so it must have been introduced with 3.0.8.1.~~ on other instances and so far I have no idea why that is. I'll update the issue as soon as I know more.

issue.title: Implement SAML authentication for GL3
issue.body:
Description WIP (missing detailed explanation)

This PR enables SAML authentication for GL3 and is based on similar PRs for GL2: https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/1334 and https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/2270 . We are using this feature in production, but it was not developed with the goal to be merged upstream. Because SAML for GL2 was never merged, I guess it won't happen for GL3 as well. However, I'd like to provide our development to the public for anyone in need of this.

We have also made some corresponding changes to the migration task in GL2.

This is the part of a series of similar PR submissions (Redis Sentinel, SAML integration, LDAP integration).

comment.body:
@farhatahmad Thank you, that's great.

FYI: I have made another PR https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/5480 , which is a subset of this one here. It is designed to be easily mergeable and lessen the burden of maintaining custom provider extensions. Please let me know your thoughts on that one.

issue.title: Add env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replace checks for OPENID_CONNECT with checks for EXTERNAL_AUTH where applicable
issue.body:
Since OIDC is currently the only implemented external authentication provider, in all the places where you would normally check for external auth usage there is instead a check for OIDC usage. This PR introduces a new env EXTERNAL_AUTH and replaces these checks with a check for EXTERNAL_AUTH. Also a few comments are left at places where additional providers would have to be "added".

This paves the way for addition of other external auth providers and, even if there are no plans to develop these from upstream side, makes it easier to develop and maintain extensions such as https://github.com/bigbluebutton/greenlight/pull/5476 . Also, it will not require any additional effort to maintain the changes made in this PR and it does not change the current behavior of GL3. 

If any changes have to be made to make this mergeable, I'm happy to work on them. Please let me know!
